requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Role-based user management with Infra Admin, admin, user, and reader roles

security_controls.requirement: The organization manages information system accounts, including establishing, activating, modifying, disabling, and removing accounts; and reviewing accounts periodically.
security_controls.relevance: This control applies because role-based user management requires formal account lifecycle management (create/modify/remove) for different roles (Infra Admin, admin, user, reader). Periodic review ensures roles remain appropriate.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement automated account provisioning/deprovisioning tied to role assignments and HR/identity sources. Schedule periodic reviews and generate reports for each role to validate correctness.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect account management procedures, review automated provisioning logs, and verify periodic account review reports and remediation actions.

security_controls.requirement: The information system enforces approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.
security_controls.relevance: Enforcement of role-based authorizations is required to ensure that Infra Admin, admin, user, and reader roles only access permitted resources and actions.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce role checks centrally (e.g., IAM, RBAC middleware) for all APIs and GUIs; integrate with policy engine to map high-level roles to permissions.
security_controls.verification_method: Review access control policy, run functional tests covering each role's allowed/denied actions, and audit enforcement logs.

security_controls.requirement: A formal user registration and de-registration process should be implemented to enable assignment of access rights.
security_controls.relevance: Role-based user management needs formal registration/de-registration processes to assign or revoke role memberships and ensure accountability.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define formal workflows for onboarding and offboarding mapping to role assignments; track approvals and record evidence for audits.
security_controls.verification_method: Examine registration/de-registration procedures, sample user records, and evidence of approvals for role assignments.

security_controls.section: Access to networks and network services
security_controls.requirement: Users should only be provided with access to the network and network services that they have been specifically authorized to use.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that role-based assignments (e.g., Infra Admin vs reader) translate to network/service access restrictions in the infrastructure.
security_controls.integration_tips: Map roles to least-privilege network/service access and enforce via network ACLs, security groups, and service-level authorizations.
security_controls.verification_method: Review role-to-network mappings, inspect network access policies, and test access controls per role.

security_controls.requirement: The application implements role-based access control and enforces authorization checks on all server-side functions and data access points.
security_controls.relevance: Directly addresses application-level enforcement of RBAC which is necessary for separating duties among Infra Admin, admin, user, and reader.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure server-side checks for every endpoint and data access; avoid relying on client-side controls and centralize role decisions in a trusted component.
security_controls.verification_method: Perform code reviews and penetration tests to verify server-side authorization checks and test bypass attempts.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Per-VM access mapping and permission management with audit trails

security_controls.requirement: The organization employs the principle of least privilege, ensuring users and processes are granted only the access necessary to perform their duties.
security_controls.relevance: Per-VM access mapping requires least-privilege assignment for users/processes interacting with each VM to minimize risk.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define granular VM-level roles and permissions, restrict SSH/API access per VM, and implement just-in-time access where possible.
security_controls.verification_method: Review VM permission matrices and test that accounts cannot exceed assigned privileges on target VMs.

security_controls.requirement: The organization determines auditable events and configures auditing to capture them to support after-action investigations and monitoring.
security_controls.relevance: Audit trails for per-VM permission changes and access need explicit audit event selection and capture.
security_controls.integration_tips: Instrument VM management components to log access grants/revocations, privilege elevations, and session activity; centralize logs to SIEM.
security_controls.verification_method: Check audit configuration, sample logs for VM access events, and verify retention and integrity controls.

security_controls.requirement: Access to information and application system functions should be restricted in accordance with the access control policy.
security_controls.relevance: Supports restricting access at the VM level according to defined permissions and mapping.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement access enforcement in hypervisor/management plane and map system functions to roles; document and enforce VM-level policies.
security_controls.verification_method: Review access restriction configurations and test enforcement across VM management interfaces.

security_controls.requirement: Access control policies are integrated into the architecture and consistently enforced across all components.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that per-VM permissions are part of consistent architecture and enforcement across the environment.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use centralized policy enforcement points for VM access and verify that all management APIs honor the same policy decisions.
security_controls.verification_method: Architectural review and functional tests ensuring consistent policy enforcement across components.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Per-VM firewall rules: allowed ingress/egress ports and stored port assignments

security_controls.requirement: The information system monitors and controls communications at the external boundary and key internal boundaries of the system.
security_controls.relevance: Per-VM firewall rules and stored port assignments are boundary protections controlling ingress/egress at VM/network boundaries.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply per-VM firewall or security group controls, maintain a central repository of port assignments, and enforce via network virtualization or host-based firewalls.
security_controls.verification_method: Review firewall/security group rules, test allowed/blocked ports on sample VMs, and verify central repository accuracy.

security_controls.requirement: Networks should be managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to managing per-VM network controls, including ingress/egress ports.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement network segmentation, maintain documented port maps per VM, and regularly review network control configurations.
security_controls.verification_method: Network configuration review, port scanning to confirm enforcement, and documentation checks.

security_controls.requirement: The organization establishes and documents configuration settings for information system components and enforces them.
security_controls.relevance: Storing and enforcing port assignments requires documented configuration baselines for VM firewall settings.
security_controls.integration_tips: Create and version control baseline firewall configs for VMs; automate deployment and drift detection.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect baseline documents, configuration management records, and automated compliance scans for drift.

security_controls.requirement: Network boundaries must be enforced and services should only be exposed on necessary ports with documented rationale.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies that services should be limited to necessary ports and documented — aligns with per-VM port assignments.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document rationale per open port, restrict services using host and network firewalls, and periodically review exposures.
security_controls.verification_method: Port exposure review, documentation audit, and penetration testing to validate restrictions.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Per-VM ingress and egress IP endpoint recording, control, reporting, and audit

security_controls.requirement: The organization reviews and analyzes information system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity and reports findings.
security_controls.relevance: Recording ingress/egress endpoints and auditing requires review and reporting of network-related audit logs for VMs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Capture network flow logs, aggregate to central logging/SIEM, and schedule automated analysis and reporting for anomalies.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify network flow log capture, review SIEM alerts and audit reports, and confirm escalation procedures.

security_controls.requirement: The organization establishes and maintains an inventory of information system components.
security_controls.relevance: Tracking ingress/egress endpoints per VM benefits from a component inventory linking VMs to IPs and endpoints.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain an authoritative inventory mapping VMs to IP addresses and endpoints; update automatically via orchestration tools.
security_controls.verification_method: Cross-check inventory records against live network configurations and flow logs.

security_controls.requirement: Event logs recording user activities, exceptions, and other security-relevant events should be produced and kept.
security_controls.relevance: Capturing ingress/egress IP events is part of producing logs for security-relevant events tied to VMs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure network logs include source/destination IPs for VM traffic, centralize log storage, and protect log integrity.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect log configurations, sample logs showing IP endpoints, and confirm retention and integrity controls.

security_controls.requirement: Applications and infrastructure should record network-relevant events sufficient to investigate incidents, including source/destination information.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates recording of source/destination (IP) information for incident investigation, matching the requirement.
security_controls.integration_tips: Log network events with timestamps, IPs, ports, and correlate with VM identifiers; feed logs into SIEM for alerting and reporting.
security_controls.verification_method: Review logs for required fields, perform incident investigations to confirm usefulness, and test correlation rules.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Project structure as layered stages (hardware, network, verification, container, storage, cloud, authz)

security_controls.requirement: Information security should be addressed in project management, including during project initiation, development, and delivery.
security_controls.relevance: Defining layered project stages requires embedding security activities into each project layer as part of project management.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate security checkpoints and owner assignments for each project layer in project lifecycle templates and gate criteria.
security_controls.verification_method: Review project plans and gating artifacts for security activities and layer-specific controls.

security_controls.section: System and Communications Protection Policy and Procedures
security_controls.requirement: Develop, document, and disseminate policies and procedures for system and communications resource protection.
security_controls.relevance: When organizing layered stages (hardware to authz), documented procedures are required for protection across layers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Create layer-specific protection procedures (hardware, network, containers, etc.) and publish them as part of system documentation.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect policy and procedural documents for layer-specific guidance and evidence of dissemination.

security_controls.requirement: Applications and systems should be designed with layered defenses and segmentation to reduce attack surface and contain compromises.
security_controls.relevance: Directly supports structuring projects in layers to enable segmentation and defense-in-depth across hardware, network, container, storage, cloud, and authz.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define clear trust boundaries between layers, enforce controls at each layer, and map responsibilities to layer owners.
security_controls.verification_method: Architecture review for segmentation, and penetration testing to ensure containment between layers.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Assignment of users to layers with explicit ownership and accountability

security_controls.requirement: Responsibilities for information security should be defined and allocated.
security_controls.relevance: Assigning users to layers with ownership requires defined responsibilities and accountability.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document role assignments per layer, include responsibilities in job descriptions, and require formal acceptance by owners.
security_controls.verification_method: Check role descriptions, layer assignment records, and evidence of owner acceptance.

security_controls.requirement: The organization defines and communicates roles and responsibilities for managing the organization's information security program.
security_controls.relevance: Supports allocating responsibilities at project/layer level and ensures accountability is communicated.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include layer ownership in program management artifacts and ensure managers are trained on their responsibilities.
security_controls.verification_method: Review program documentation and training records mapping roles to layer ownership.

security_controls.requirement: Operational roles and responsibilities should be clearly documented and enforced; accountability mechanisms should exist.
security_controls.relevance: Confirms the need to document and enforce ownership for layers and provide accountability.
security_controls.integration_tips: Establish owner dashboards, require handover approvals, and record accountable parties for each layer in a CMDB.
security_controls.verification_method: Review documentation, dashboards, and evidence of enforcement of accountability.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Layer sequencing enforcement: prerequisite completion and approval required before next layer creation

security_controls.section: Monitoring and review of supplier services
security_controls.requirement: Organisations should monitor and review services, including ensuring prerequisites and dependencies are managed.
security_controls.relevance: While focused on suppliers, the requirement to manage prerequisites and dependencies aligns with enforcing sequencing and approvals between layers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement formal gating/checkpoint procedures that require documented completion and approval before allowing the next layer's creation.
security_controls.verification_method: Audit project gates and evidence of prerequisite checks prior to layer creation.

security_controls.requirement: The organization reviews, approves, and documents changes to the information system prior to implementation.
security_controls.relevance: Enforcing sequential creation of layers with approvals is analogous to change control where prerequisites must be confirmed before changes proceed.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use change control boards and automated workflow gates in the CI/CD or project system to require approvals and prerequisite checks.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect change records, approval artifacts, and workflow enforcement logs for layer creation events.

security_controls.requirement: Changes and releases must be controlled, approved, and documented to prevent unauthorized or premature deployments.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates control and approval of changes/releases, which maps to requiring approvals before creating next project layers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate gating checks into CI/CD and project tools to prevent progression until approvals and prerequisites are recorded.
security_controls.verification_method: Review release/change records and attempt to bypass gates in a test environment to verify enforcement.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Layer deadlines, escalation to management dashboard and notifications on delays

security_controls.requirement: Information security should be addressed in project management, including during project initiation, development, and delivery.
security_controls.relevance: Project management integration supports including deadlines and escalation processes in project artifacts and dashboards.
security_controls.integration_tips: Embed timeline requirements and escalation paths in project management tools and ensure security-relevant deadlines are visible to management.
security_controls.verification_method: Review project management records and dashboard configurations for escalation rules.

security_controls.requirement: The organization develops a risk management strategy including roles, responsibilities, and escalation processes.
security_controls.relevance: Escalation for delays should be part of risk management and operational response, matching this control's intent.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define escalation thresholds tied to deadlines and integrate alerts to management dashboards when those thresholds are breached.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify escalation rules, alert generation, and confirmation that management receives notifications during test scenarios.

security_controls.requirement: Operational roles and responsibilities should be clearly documented and enforced; accountability mechanisms should exist.
security_controls.relevance: Supports accountability and escalation by ensuring roles like PM and managers are defined to receive escalations and dashboard visibility.
security_controls.integration_tips: Configure notification routing in tools based on role definitions and test notification delivery for delayed layers.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect notification rules, simulate delays, and confirm dashboard escalations.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: User dashboards and personal notifications showing assigned layers and due dates

security_controls.requirement: User dashboards must display authorized information only and protect personal and project data from unauthorized disclosure.
security_controls.relevance: Dashboards and notifications must ensure users see only their assigned layers and due dates, preventing info leakage.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce per-user authorization checks on dashboard backends and sanitize displayed data; log dashboard accesses.
security_controls.verification_method: Access control testing on dashboard endpoints and review of logs for unauthorized views.

security_controls.requirement: The organization restricts and monitors remote access mechanisms to information systems.
security_controls.relevance: If dashboards are remote, access controls and monitoring must ensure notifications and personal views are securely accessible.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require authentication for dashboard access, use HTTPS, and monitor sessions and access logs for anomalies.
security_controls.verification_method: Review authentication mechanisms, TLS config, and session logs for dashboard access.

security_controls.requirement: The allocation and use of privileged access rights should be restricted and controlled.
security_controls.relevance: Dashboards may expose privileged information; management of who can see certain dashboard data aligns with this control.
security_controls.integration_tips: Limit dashboard views via role-based filters and audit privileged dashboard functions.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect role-based dashboard views and privileged action logs.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Mandatory handover design document submission at layer completion

security_controls.requirement: The organization documents configuration and implementation decisions and maintains records to support accountability.
security_controls.relevance: Requiring handover design documents ensures documentation of configuration and design decisions at layer completion.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require document upload to a versioned repository as part of the layer completion workflow and enforce metadata standards.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify existence of submitted documents in repository, check versioning and approval metadata.

security_controls.section: Protecting application services on public networks
security_controls.requirement: Security should be built into systems and documented during development and maintenance.
security_controls.relevance: Handover documents capture security design and operational details necessary for later maintenance and assurance.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define required content for handover documents including security controls, operational runbooks, and ownership.
security_controls.verification_method: Audit handover documents for required sections and confirm signoff records.

security_controls.requirement: Changes and releases must be controlled, approved, and documented to prevent unauthorized or premature deployments.
security_controls.relevance: Handover documents are required artifacts for controlled completion of a layer before release to the next stage.
security_controls.integration_tips: Make document submission a blocking condition in the release workflow and require approver signatures.
security_controls.verification_method: Check release workflow records to ensure document submission is enforced and approvals recorded.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Approval/rejection workflow for handover with feedback loop and immutable logs

security_controls.requirement: The organization reviews, approves, and documents changes to the information system prior to implementation.
security_controls.relevance: An approval/rejection workflow with documented decisions is a form of change control which this requirement demands.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement an auditable workflow system that records approvals/rejections and associated comments; retain immutable records.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect workflow audit logs, change requests, and approval artifacts for integrity and completeness.

security_controls.requirement: Audit records are protected from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
security_controls.relevance: Immutable logs for handover approvals must be protected to prevent tampering, aligning with AU-9.
security_controls.integration_tips: Store approval logs in write-once or tamper-evident storage, restrict access, and implement integrity checks.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify storage protections, integrity checks, and access controls over audit records.

security_controls.requirement: Records of administrator and operator activities should be produced and kept to support investigations.
security_controls.relevance: Approval/rejection workflows involving administrators/operators must have immutable logs to support investigations and accountability.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure workflow systems log identity, timestamps, and actions; back logs to secure storage and protect retention.
security_controls.verification_method: Review logs for required fields and confirm retention and access protection controls.

security_controls.requirement: Logs must be protected from unauthorized modification and should be sufficient to support forensics and accountability.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures logs from approval workflows are reliable and tamper-resistant, enabling feedback loops and investigations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use append-only logs, sign log entries, and forward logs to an external trusted collector for preservation.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect log signing mechanisms, retention policies, and perform integrity verification on sample logs.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Post-completion user availability requirement to address blockers/dependencies

security_controls.requirement: Information security should be addressed in project management, including during project initiation, development, and delivery.
security_controls.relevance: Requiring user availability post-completion ties into project management responsibilities and security-related continuity of support.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include post-completion availability requirements in project SLAs and owner responsibilities; track availability windows in schedules.
security_controls.verification_method: Review SLAs and project records showing agreed availability and observed adherence.

security_controls.requirement: The organization develops and implements contingency plans for critical systems and processes.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that necessary personnel availability and procedures exist to address blockers and dependencies post-completion as part of continuity planning.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define contingency contacts and post-completion support expectations in the contingency plan and escalate when unavailable.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect contingency plans for post-completion support clauses and test call trees or contact responsiveness.

security_controls.requirement: Operational roles and responsibilities should be clearly documented and enforced; accountability mechanisms should exist.
security_controls.relevance: Supports ensuring assigned personnel remain available and accountable after layer completion to address issues.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document post-handover contact windows and require signoff confirming availability; log responses and escalations.
security_controls.verification_method: Check documentation of availability commitments and test escalation/contact procedures.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Air-gapped project support: isolated server for initial downloads and prerequisite tooling

security_controls.requirement: Networks should be managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.
security_controls.relevance: Air-gapped environments require explicit network controls and isolation measures to protect downloads and tooling on isolated servers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement physical and logical isolation controls for the air-gapped server, restrict interfaces, and document transfer processes.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect network diagrams, isolation controls, and physical separation evidence for air-gapped servers.

security_controls.requirement: The information system protects against and limits the effects of unauthorized connections and communication channels.
security_controls.relevance: Supports isolation requirements and preventing unauthorized connections in air-gapped setups used for initial downloads.
security_controls.integration_tips: Harden and restrict ports on the isolated server, control removable media usage, and enforce strict transfer policies.
security_controls.verification_method: Review firewall and physical port controls, and test for absence of unauthorized network paths.

security_controls.section: Support for air-gapped or offline environments
security_controls.requirement: Systems should provide mechanisms to operate in air-gapped or disconnected environments, including secure transfer and validation of artifacts.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable for ensuring initial downloads and tooling are securely handled in an air-gapped server.
security_controls.integration_tips: Provide secure artifact transfer procedures, integrity checks (signatures/hashes), and documented validation steps for imported tooling.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify transfer procedures, check integrity validations, and test offline deployment procedures.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Automated local repository mirroring and storage of required images/tools on bare-metal servers

security_controls.requirement: The organization establishes and maintains an inventory of information system components.
security_controls.relevance: Mirroring repositories and storing images/tools on bare-metal requires inventories and tracking of stored artifacts and components.
security_controls.integration_tips: Automate inventory updates when mirrors are created; tag images with provenance and versions and maintain a catalog.
security_controls.verification_method: Review inventory entries for mirrored repositories and check version/provenance metadata.

security_controls.requirement: The organization establishes and documents configuration settings for information system components and enforces them.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures mirrored repositories and storage hosts adhere to hardened configuration baselines and secure settings.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply hardened baselines to repository hosts, automate updates with integrity checks, and restrict write access to mirrors.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect baseline configs, run compliance scans on mirror hosts, and review access control lists.

security_controls.requirement: Information processing facilities should be monitored to ensure adequate capacity to deliver services.
security_controls.relevance: Maintaining local mirrors requires capacity planning and monitoring to ensure availability of images/tools on bare-metal servers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement storage monitoring, automated sync schedules, and alerting for low capacity or mirror sync failures.
security_controls.verification_method: Review monitoring dashboards and sync logs to confirm mirroring operational health.

security_controls.section: Support for air-gapped or offline environments
security_controls.requirement: Systems should provide mechanisms to operate in air-gapped or disconnected environments, including secure transfer and validation of artifacts.
security_controls.relevance: Addresses offline mirroring and secure hosting of images/tools for isolated/bare-metal environments.
security_controls.integration_tips: Automate mirror creation with integrity verification, store signed images, and restrict modification to authorized processes.
security_controls.verification_method: Check signed image presence, sync logs, and access restrictions on mirror storage.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Guaranteed access to bare-metal repository after network disconnection for all project servers

security_controls.requirement: The organization restores information systems and assets to a known secure state following a disruption.
security_controls.relevance: Guaranteeing access to local repositories after network disconnection is part of contingency planning and recovery for build dependencies.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design repositories to be accessible over local network only and include validation steps in recovery plans to bring them online after disconnection.
security_controls.verification_method: Test disconnection scenarios and verify servers can access local mirrors and complete deployments.

security_controls.chapter: Information security aspects of business continuity management
security_controls.requirement: The organization should determine requirements for information security continuity and implement controls to meet them.
security_controls.relevance: Ensuring bare-metal repository access post-disconnection aligns with planning for continuity of security-critical operations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document repository availability requirements in continuity plans and include restoration/verification steps in runbooks.
security_controls.verification_method: Review continuity plans and perform tabletop/exercise to confirm repository access under disconnected conditions.

security_controls.section: Support for air-gapped or offline environments
security_controls.requirement: Systems should provide mechanisms to operate in air-gapped or disconnected environments, including secure transfer and validation of artifacts.
security_controls.relevance: Specifically applicable to guaranteeing local artifact availability after network disconnection.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure local caches are validated for integrity before disconnection and that services reference local endpoints by configuration.
security_controls.verification_method: Execute planned disconnection tests and verify that servers successfully pull required images/tools from local repo.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Real-time notifications to project manager upon layer completion (email/chat/internal alerts)

security_controls.requirement: The organization requires personnel to report incidents to appropriate internal organizations within defined timeframes.
security_controls.relevance: Real-time notifications map to timely reporting requirements — ensuring PMs receive immediate alerts on key events like layer completion.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate completion events with messaging/notification services ensuring authenticated, encrypted delivery to PMs and that notifications are logged.
security_controls.verification_method: Test notification flows for completeness and timeliness and check logs for successful deliveries.

security_controls.section: Assessment and decision on information security events
security_controls.requirement: Information security events should be assessed and decisions on response actions should be taken.
security_controls.relevance: While focused on incidents, the control emphasizes timely assessments and notifications to responsible parties, applicable for structured notifications to PMs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define notification templates and channels for layer completion and ensure PMs are configured as recipients in the system.
security_controls.verification_method: Review notification configuration and simulate layer completion to validate delivery.

security_controls.requirement: Notifications should not leak sensitive information and should be delivered securely while preserving integrity.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures real-time notifications to PM are secure and do not reveal sensitive project details to unintended recipients.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use authenticated channels (TLS, provider API keys), redact sensitive info from outbound notifications, and log notification events.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect notification content templates, delivery channels, and logs for privacy and integrity checks.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Notifications to all project members when a layer completes, including status and reports

security_controls.section: Assessment and decision on information security events
security_controls.requirement: Information security events should be assessed and decisions on response actions should be taken.
security_controls.relevance: Requires assessment and appropriate notification actions; relevant for structured notifications to project members including status and reports.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define audience lists and templates for status notifications, ensure reports are accessible only to authorized project members, and log distributions.
security_controls.verification_method: Review distribution lists, templates, and delivery logs to confirm authorized dissemination.

security_controls.requirement: Notifications should not leak sensitive information and should be delivered securely while preserving integrity.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures mass notifications to project members don't expose sensitive info and are delivered securely.
security_controls.integration_tips: Redact or link to secure reports rather than embedding sensitive data in notifications; use secure access controls on report storage.
security_controls.verification_method: Examine notification examples and verify secure access to linked reports and logs of deliveries.

security_controls.requirement: The organization tracks and documents information system events to ensure proper response and communications.
security_controls.relevance: Supports tracking and documenting events (like layer completion) and communicating results to stakeholders.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain event logs for layer completions and use audit trails to demonstrate who received notifications and when.
security_controls.verification_method: Check event logs, notification receipts, and communication audit trails.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Advance notification (one week) to user slated to start next layer via preferred channels

security_controls.requirement: The organization develops a risk management strategy including roles, responsibilities, and escalation processes.
security_controls.relevance: Scheduling and advance notification are part of program management and risk mitigation to prepare resources and reduce delays.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement scheduled notifications in project tooling with configurable lead times and preferred channel settings per user.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify scheduling rules and simulate advance-notification delivery.

security_controls.section: Information security awareness, education and training
security_controls.requirement: All employees should receive appropriate awareness and training regarding information security responsibilities.
security_controls.relevance: While not directly about notifications, ensuring users are aware of responsibilities and notifications supports readiness when starting layers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include expectations about advance notifications in onboarding and role-specific training.
security_controls.verification_method: Check training materials for mention of notification procedures and perform surveys on awareness.

security_controls.requirement: Notifications should not leak sensitive information and should be delivered securely while preserving integrity.
security_controls.relevance: Ensure advance notices are delivered securely and do not expose sensitive scheduling or project content to unauthorized viewers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use secure notification channels and configurable user preferences to deliver advance notices, and log deliveries.
security_controls.verification_method: Test delivery to preferred channels and verify secure content handling.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Integration with project monitoring system to raise alarms for critical events/blockers pre-project

security_controls.requirement: The organization monitors the information system to detect attacks and indicators of potential incidents.
security_controls.relevance: Project monitoring integration requires capability to raise alarms for critical events; SI-4 provides monitoring guidance applicable to project-critical systems.
security_controls.integration_tips: Instrument CI/CD, task trackers, and infrastructure to emit events to monitoring/alerting platforms and ensure defined thresholding.
security_controls.verification_method: Confirm event feeds, alert rules, and test alarm triggering for simulated blockers.

security_controls.requirement: Event logs recording user activities, exceptions, and other security-relevant events should be produced and kept.
security_controls.relevance: Project monitoring relies on event logs and consistent event generation for raising alarms and tracking blockers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure project and infrastructure tools emit structured logs and integrate them with monitoring systems for correlation and alerting.
security_controls.verification_method: Audit event export configurations and test end-to-end alert generation.

security_controls.requirement: Systems must implement monitoring and alerting for security-relevant events to support timely detection and response.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to raising alarms for critical project events and blockers before they impact project timelines.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define event classifications, map them to alert severity levels in monitoring tools, and set escalation policies.
security_controls.verification_method: Review monitoring rules, simulate critical events, and confirm alerts and escalations occur.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: System administrator log summary reports on failures or critical errors

security_controls.requirement: The organization reviews and analyzes information system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity and reports findings.
security_controls.relevance: Generating administrator log summary reports on failures or critical errors requires systematic review and reporting as called for by AU-6.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement automated log analysis to produce periodic summaries of failures/errors and distribute them to administrators.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect report generation schedules and sample summary reports with associated logs and analysis.

security_controls.requirement: Event logs recording user activities, exceptions, and other security-relevant events should be produced and kept.
security_controls.relevance: Supports requirement to produce logs that can be summarized into administrator reports.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure logs capture sufficient detail (timestamps, error codes) and retention to allow summarization and trend analysis.
security_controls.verification_method: Check log schemas, retention, and sample summaries for completeness.

security_controls.requirement: Systems must implement monitoring and alerting for security-relevant events to support timely detection and response.
security_controls.relevance: Enables creation of alerts and summarized reports to administrators about failures and critical errors.
security_controls.integration_tips: Configure dashboards and scheduled summaries in monitoring/SIEM tools and ensure distribution to sysadmins.
security_controls.verification_method: Review monitoring configurations and validate scheduled summaries reach administrators.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Project manager reporting and role/assignment records with progress tracking

security_controls.requirement: Responsibilities for information security should be defined and allocated.
security_controls.relevance: Maintaining role/assignment records and progress tracking requires defined responsibilities and assignment records.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain an authoritative record of role assignments, tie them to project tasks, and enable PM reporting from the system of record.
security_controls.verification_method: Review role assignment records and sample PM reports verifying traceability.

security_controls.requirement: The organization defines and communicates roles and responsibilities for managing the organization's information security program.
security_controls.relevance: Supports the need for role assignment records and clarity for PM reporting purposes.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure role definitions are integrated into project tooling and that PM reports extract role-based progress metrics.
security_controls.verification_method: Validate PM reports against role assignment records and interview PMs for completeness.

security_controls.requirement: Applications should present role-appropriate views and reporting to users while protecting other users' data.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures PM views show aggregated progress while respecting access boundaries and role-based restrictions.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement role-filtered report generation and ensure data used in reports comes from authorized sources.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect PM reports and access controls for proper role-based filtering.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Manager-facing dashboard showing progress by layer, status, and deadlines

security_controls.requirement: User dashboards must display authorized information only and protect personal and project data from unauthorized disclosure.
security_controls.relevance: Manager dashboard must ensure only authorized managers see aggregated progress and sensitive details as authorized.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply role-based access, mask sensitive data, and require strong authentication for manager dashboard access.
security_controls.verification_method: Access control testing and review of dashboard audit logs for unauthorized access attempts.

security_controls.requirement: The organization employs the principle of least privilege, ensuring users and processes are granted only the access necessary to perform their duties.
security_controls.relevance: Manager dashboard should adhere to least privilege so only managers see required summary info and can act on it.
security_controls.integration_tips: Grant dashboard access only to manager roles and provide read-only views unless explicit privileges are required.
security_controls.verification_method: Review role assignments and attempt to access manager dashboard with non-manager accounts.

security_controls.section: Access to networks and network services
security_controls.requirement: Users should only be provided with access to the network and network services that they have been specifically authorized to use.
security_controls.relevance: Manager dashboard access should be explicitly authorized and restricted to appropriate network/services.
security_controls.integration_tips: Restrict dashboard access by network segments and enforce MFA for manager roles.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect authorization records and MFA enforcement for manager accounts.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Conflict/tracker list for bugs and blockers with statuses (Blocked, Untriaged, In Progress, Fixed)

security_controls.requirement: The organization establishes and maintains an inventory of information system components.
security_controls.relevance: A tracker of bugs and blockers should map to components and maintain inventory and status to manage configuration and issues.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate issue tracker with inventory/CMDB so statuses map to affected components and owners.
security_controls.verification_method: Check linkage between tracker items and CMDB entries for sample issues.

security_controls.requirement: Operating procedures should be documented and made available to all users who need them.
security_controls.relevance: Procedures for handling bug statuses and escalations should be documented and available to relevant staff operating the tracker.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define lifecycle states for issues and establish escalation paths tied to statuses; document procedures in the tracker.
security_controls.verification_method: Review documented procedures and confirm they map to tracker workflows.

security_controls.requirement: Systems must implement monitoring and alerting for security-relevant events to support timely detection and response.
security_controls.relevance: Trackers should generate alerts for critical blockers and status changes to ensure timely attention and response.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define alert rules for status transitions (e.g., Blocked) and route to appropriate on-call personnel and dashboards.
security_controls.verification_method: Test alert generation for status changes and confirm recipients receive notifications.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Mandatory completion of handover documentation and final report for each layer within one week of deadline

security_controls.requirement: The organization documents configuration and implementation decisions and maintains records to support accountability.
security_controls.relevance: Mandating documentation within a timeframe ensures records are maintained for accountability similar to CM-7 expectations for documentation.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce time-bound submission via workflow automation and send reminders/escalations if reports are not submitted within the week.
security_controls.verification_method: Review workflow logs for submission timestamps and overdue escalations.

security_controls.requirement: Where development is outsourced, agreements should address security requirements including deliverables and timelines.
security_controls.relevance: Specifying timelines for handover documentation aligns with ensuring deliverables and schedules are met and auditable.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include one-week completion SLA in project delivery contracts and track compliance.
security_controls.verification_method: Check contractual SLAs and sample delivery adherence reports.

security_controls.requirement: Changes and releases must be controlled, approved, and documented to prevent unauthorized or premature deployments.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that handover documentation and final reports are part of controlled release processes with timelines.
security_controls.integration_tips: Make final report submission and approval required gates in release workflows and prevent sign-off until completed.
security_controls.verification_method: Review release workflow enforcement and document timestamps for handover completion.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Generation and sending of formal progress summaries from PM to customers with traceability

security_controls.section: Contact with authorities and special interest groups
security_controls.requirement: The organization should maintain contact with relevant external parties and manage communications appropriately.
security_controls.relevance: Formal progress summaries to customers require controlled communications and traceability to ensure accurate and appropriate disclosures.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain communication logs, versioned reports, and approval chains before sending summaries to customers to ensure traceability.
security_controls.verification_method: Audit sent summaries, approvals, and communication logs for traceability.

security_controls.section: System and Communications Protection Policy and Procedures
security_controls.requirement: Develop, document, and disseminate policies and procedures for system and communications resource protection.
security_controls.relevance: Policies/procedures for communicating progress to external customers are needed to ensure consistency and protect sensitive info.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define templates and approval workflows for customer-facing summaries and ensure sensitive details are redacted or controlled.
security_controls.verification_method: Review communication procedures and sample approved summaries for compliance.

security_controls.requirement: Notifications should not leak sensitive information and should be delivered securely while preserving integrity.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures progress summaries sent externally maintain integrity and privacy and are traceable to internal approvals.
security_controls.integration_tips: Sign or otherwise verify report integrity, maintain an audit trail of distribution, and avoid embedding sensitive details directly in messages.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify signed reports, distribution logs, and redaction practices.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Secure SSH access to infrastructure resources and web-based access for workflows

security_controls.requirement: The organization restricts and monitors remote access mechanisms to information systems.
security_controls.relevance: Securing SSH and web-based access requires restricting remote access and monitoring per AC-17.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use centralized bastion hosts, enforce MFA for SSH/web access, restrict allowed sources, and monitor sessions.
security_controls.verification_method: Review bastion configurations, MFA enforcement, session logs, and attempt controlled access tests.

security_controls.requirement: The organization manages authentication methods and enforces multi-factor authentication where required.
security_controls.relevance: SSH and web workflows need strong authenticator management (keys, passwords, MFA) to prevent unauthorized access.
security_controls.integration_tips: Rotate SSH keys, use certificate-based SSH where possible, enforce MFA for web portals, and centralize credential management.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect key management procedures, MFA logs, and authentication configuration for SSH and web services.

security_controls.requirement: Remote access mechanisms and authentication for web and management interfaces should be hardened and protected.
security_controls.relevance: Directly addresses securing web-based access and remote management interfaces like SSH-accessed infrastructure.
security_controls.integration_tips: Harden management interfaces, disable password auth for SSH in favor of keys/certificates, and ensure TLS for web-based access.
security_controls.verification_method: Penetration tests of management interfaces, review of SSH and TLS configurations, and credential audits.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Support for initial internet access for image pulls and IaC integrations, with local-hosting alternative if restricted

security_controls.requirement: The organization protects the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.
security_controls.relevance: When pulling images/IaC over the internet or using local-hosting alternatives, transmissions must be protected to ensure integrity and confidentiality.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use TLS/HTTPS for pulls, validate image signatures/hashes, and provide secure local mirrors for restricted environments.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect TLS configs, validate signature checks, and test pull workflows against local mirrors.

security_controls.section: Support for air-gapped or offline environments
security_controls.requirement: Systems should provide mechanisms to operate in air-gapped or disconnected environments, including secure transfer and validation of artifacts.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant for having a local-hosting alternative and secure validation of pulled images and IaC artifacts.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement signed artifacts, mirror repositories, and validate integrity before deployment in restricted networks.
security_controls.verification_method: Test internet and local-hosted pull scenarios and verify signature/hash validations.

security_controls.section: Installation of software on operational systems
security_controls.requirement: Procedures should be implemented to control the installation of software on operational systems.
security_controls.relevance: Pulling images and IaC into operational systems must follow controlled installation procedures and validations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define approved sources, require artifact signing, and document local-hosting fallback procedures for restricted environments.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect software installation procedures, allowed source lists, and artifact validation logs.

User dashboards and personal notifications showing assigned layers and due dates
Secure SSH access to infrastructure resources and web-based access for workflows
Manager-facing dashboard showing progress by layer, status, and deadlines
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Centralize role management in IAM, enforce server-side authorization checks, integrate with HR/identity sources for lifecycle, and schedule regular access reviews.

Air-gapped project support: isolated server for initial downloads and prerequisite tooling
Support for initial internet access for image pulls and IaC integrations, with local-hosting alternative if restricted
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Require signed artifacts, verify hashes during synchronization and deployment, and maintain provenance metadata in repositories.

cross_functional_controls.description: Enforce change control and gating for layer sequencing, handovers, and releases with documented approvals and immutable records.

Approval/rejection workflow for handover with feedback loop and immutable logs
Mandatory completion of handover documentation and final report for each layer within one week of deadline

cross_functional_controls.description: Segment networks and enforce per-VM firewall/security group rules to restrict ingress/egress ports and endpoints.

Per-VM ingress and egress IP endpoint recording, control, reporting, and audit
Guaranteed access to bare-metal repository after network disconnection for all project servers
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Define port/endpoint baselines, implement host-based and network-level firewalls, enforce via IaC, and monitor for deviations with automated alerts.
